Title: SoftBank Founder Masayoshi Son Lost $130 Million on Bitcoin
Summary: Masayoshi Son made a huge personal bet on bitcoin just as prices peaked, losing more than $130 million when he sold out.

Title: Big Bitcoin Exchange Ends Bid to Lure High-Speed Traders
Summary: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase is ending an ambitious effort to win over high-frequency traders, the latest sign that bitcoin companies are having trouble attracting mainstream financial players.

Title: Treasury Bureau Issues First Penalty for Peer-to-Peer Digital Currency Exchange
Summary: The Treasury Department’s financial crimes unit fined a California man it accused of violating anti-money-laundering laws, saying he exchanged bitcoins hundreds of times on behalf of customers without a license.

Title: Private-Jet Cryptocurrency Gets Pass From SEC
Summary: A private-jet company won the ability to sell a digital token that doesn’t require oversight by financial regulators. The hitch: The token won’t operate like others, diminishing its allure to fans of cryptocurrencies.

Title: Bitcoin Rises 16%, Touching $5,000 in Asia
Summary: Bitcoin prices rose 16% in New York, the largest percentage gain there since December 2017. In Asia, the digital currency topped $5,000 for the first time this year.

Title: Raising Money in the Crypto World Has Gotten a Lot Harder
Summary: The market for initial coin offerings, which boomed last year after the surge in bitcoin and other digital currencies, has fallen sharply in 2019 amid a regulatory crackdown.

Title: Coinbase’s New Customer Incentive: Interest Payments, With a Crypto Twist
Summary: Coinbase, a platform where users can buy and sell bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, is launching a program for institutional investors that will pay them a set interest rate, likely up to 8%, when they park money there.

Title: Bitcoin in the Wilderness
Summary: On a Canadian oil field, natural gas with nowhere to go powers a bitcoin-mining operation.

Title: Cryptocurrency Miner Bitmain’s Hong Kong IPO Application Lapses
Summary: Bitmain Technologies, the world’s largest cryptocurrency mining company, said it plans to go public in the future after a six-month deadline on its current listing application lapsed.

Title: Most Bitcoin Trading Faked by Unregulated Exchanges, Study Finds
Summary: Nearly 95% of all reported trading in bitcoin is artificially created by unregulated exchanges, a new study concludes, raising fresh doubts about the nascent market following a steep decline in prices over the past year.

Title: Bitcoin Futures Launch Hits Regulatory Snag
Summary: A plan by New York Stock Exchange-parent Intercontinental Exchange to launch the first physically-settled bitcoin futures contract has hit a regulatory snag.

Title: Bitcoin Is in the Dumps, Spreading Gloom Over Crypto World
Summary: Bitcoin is in the longest slump of its 10-year history, forcing supporters to shelve dreams of global disruption and focus simply on outlasting the downturn.

Title: Cboe Abandons Bitcoin Futures
Summary: Cboe Global Markets has pulled the plug on bitcoin futures, the latest sign that mainstream financial firms are losing their enthusiasm for cryptocurrencies.

Title: Former Mt. Gox Bitcoin Bigwig Unlikely to Do More Jail Time After Beating Embezzlement Charges
Summary: The former chief of the collapsed Mt. Gox bitcoin exchange, once the world’s biggest, won a not-guilty verdict Friday on the more serious charges against him and was given a sentence that probably won’t include prison time.

Title: ‘Our Cash Went to Something’: Customers Hunt for Bankrupt Crypto Exchange’s Missing Millions
Summary: An unusual cash-pickup system is the latest unusual business practice at Quadriga to emerge since Gerald Cotten, the firm’s 30-year-old co-founder and CEO, died in India late last year.

Title: A Crypto-Mystery: Is $136 Million Stuck or Missing?
Summary: Canadian cryptocurrency exchange Quadriga says customers’ holdings are trapped in an electronic vault after the firm’s founder died without revealing the access keys to unlock his laptop. Two researchers, though, say the money might be missing.

Title: AMD Guides for Slower Growth This Year
Summary: Advanced Micro Devices expects revenue this year to grow at a more conservative pace as the chip maker faces weaker sales of graphics processors with the cooling of a once-hot cryptocurrency market.

Title: Two Groups Account for $1 Billion in Cryptocurrency Hacks, New Report Says
Summary: According to Chainalysis, the two entities, which are likely still active, employed an extensive network of digital wallets to hide their tracks and later converted the money to physical cash through online exchanges and individual transactions.

Title: Are ICO Tokens Securities? Startup Wants a Judge to Decide
Summary: Canadian startup Kik Interactive plans to challenge Washington’s ability to regulate the fledgling cryptocurrency industry.

Title: Outsmart the Scammers: How You Can Avoid Fraud
Summary: More Americans are falling victim to financial fraud, as scammers excel at identifying victims’ weaknesses and insecurities; learn to identify the signs of a scam to protect yourself.

Title: Bank of Canada Explores Bitcoin’s Technology
Summary: The Bank of Canada said it is studying the technology that underlies the digital currency bitcoin, conducting one of the first known tests by a major central bank about how it could use the nascent system known as blockchain.

Title: Two Accused in J.P. Morgan Hacking Case Plead Not Guilty
Summary: In their first U.S. court appearances, two Israeli men pleaded not guilty to charges that they broke into a dozen companies’ computer networks, including J.P. Morgan, to facilitate a global network of criminal activity.

Title: Does Nasdaq Shine for Chinese Firms?
Summary: CEO Bob Greifeld discusses whether Nasdaq has lost its appeal, and the implications of blockchain

Title: Can Bitcoin Technology Solve the Migrant Crisis?
Summary: Staci Warden of the Milken Institute argues that the blockchain could be the future of border control.

Title: China Buying Sparks Bitcoin Surge
Summary: Chinese investors are pumping up bitcoin again, sending prices up nearly 16% in the past four days, just two years after the country was at the center of a boom and bust in the crypto-currency.

Title: Bitcoin Catches On With Gold Bugs
Summary: Bitcoin is gaining traction with modern-day gold bugs who question the stability of paper currencies or worry about protecting their savings during the next financial crisis.

Title: Blockchain Startup Hires Ex-Citadel Executive
Summary: A startup developing uses of the technology underlying bitcoin for trading derivatives has hired a former senior banker and Citadel executive as its chief operating officer.

Title: Bitcoin’s Mr. Wright Now Says He Won’t Prove He Started Currency
Summary: Craig Steven Wright, the Australian businessman who this week said he was the creator of the digital currency bitcoin, abruptly pulled his offer to provide more proof.

Title: Craig Wright Says He Will Prove He Is Bitcoin Creator ‘Satoshi Nakamoto’
Summary: Australian businessman Craig Wright says he will prove that he is Satoshi Nakamoto, inventor of virtual currency bitcoin.

Title: Craig Wright Claims He Is Bitcoin Inventor ‘Satoshi Nakamoto’
Summary: Australian computer scientist Craig Wright says that he is “Satoshi Nakamoto,” the virtual currency’s pseudonymous creator.

Title: Bitcoin-Focused Investment Firm Brings On Western Union, Lawrence Summers
Summary: Digital Currency Group, an investment firm focused on bitcoin and blockchain startups, is adding a new group of investors and advisers, bringing on Western Union and former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers.

Title: ETFs’ ‘Spider Woman’ Argues for a Bitcoin Fund
Summary: Kathleen Moriarty, a top lawyer in the ETF business, intends to convince regulators that a bitcoin ETF is appropriate for the market.

Title: Bitcoin Technology’s Next Big Test: Trillion-Dollar Repo Market
Summary: Depository Trust & Clearing Corp. is about to give the technology behind bitcoin a big test: seeing whether it can be used to bolster the $2.6 trillion repo market.

Title: A Better Way to Rate Your Uber Driver?
Summary: Dan Ariely answers readers’ questions on incentives for service and tests for investments.

Title: ‘Fintech’ Will Mostly End in Tears, Christopher Flowers Says
Summary: The “fintech” revolution will end badly for most startups, according to veteran financial-services investor J. Christopher Flowers.

Title: JPMorgan Quietly Tests ‘Blockchain’ With 2,200 Clients
Summary: J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. is quietly testing technology that underpins the digital currency bitcoin on U.S. dollar transfers between London and Tokyo, part of an effort to boost its spending to deal with emerging threats from Silicon Valley.

Title: IBM Bets on Bitcoin Ledger
Summary: IBM will begin testing its own variation on the transactional software known as blockchain, a technology that underpins the Bitcoin digital currency.

Title: Bitcoin Startup Blockstream Raises $55 Million in Funding Round
Summary: Bitcoin startup Blockstream raised $55 million in a funding round that included Horizons Ventures, Hong Kong magnate Li Ka-shing’s venture-capital firm.

Title: Is Bitcoin Breaking Up?
Summary: A rift in the bitcoin world is widening over an arcane but critical technical issue that has divided the community for nearly a year.

Title: Central Bankers Explore Response to Bitcoin: Their Own Digital Cash
Summary: Amid the rising popularity of bitcoin and other private digital currency technologies, central bankers around the world are studying the possibility of issuing virtual money backed by the government itself.

Title: A Vision of Money’s Digital Future, From Cash to Code
Summary: Sebastian Mallaby, a senior fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations, on currency’s coming transition.

Title: Reported Bitcoin Founder’s Sydney Home Raided by Police
Summary: The Australian cybersecurity expert was named by media outlets as the co-inventor of the digital currency.

Title: Former Secret Service Agent Sentenced for Stealing Bitcoin
Summary: Shaun W. Bridges will serve nearly six years in prison and agreed to pay $1.1 million for stealing the virtual currency during an investigation into the now-shuttered website Silk Road.

Title: Bitcoin Fund Linked to Currency’s Rally
Summary: Spotlight: Heavy trading in Bitcoin Investment Trust may have contributed to the bitcoin price spike.

Title: Canadian Man Arrested for Alleged Role as Silk Road Advisor
Summary: A Canadian man described in court documents as a high-ranking operative in the now-shuttered online black-market site Silk Road has been arrested in Thailand, authorities said.

Title: Bitcoin Can Be Donated to Fidelity Charitable Fund
Summary: Fidelity Investments’ charitable fund is accepting donations of bitcoin. Donor-advised funds, such as Fidelity Charitable, enable investors to receive a tax deduction for a charitable donation immediately but give them the flexibility to direct grants to individual charities over time.

Title: Bitcoin Technology Poised to Grow, CEO Says
Summary: Bitcoin’s underlying technology will quietly alter industries and ultimately win over consumers, the CEO of bitcoin startup 21 Inc. said.

Title: Follow the Money—to a Museum in NYC
Summary: Every city has its beloved art museums, venerable historical societies and treasured libraries. But how many towns offer multiple exhibits for folks who want to gawk at money? There’s no place like New York.

Title: Texas Man Admits to Bitcoin Ponzi Scheme
Summary: Trendon T. Shavers admitted Monday to running a bitcoin Ponzi scheme, the first such federal criminal securities fraud case.

Title: IBM Adapts Bitcoin Technology for Smart Contracts
Summary: IBM to release open source software that could be used to create digital contracts that—like bitcoin transactions—would be recorded publicly and securely on a world-wide computer network.

Title: Visa, Nasdaq, Others Invest $30 Million in Bitcoin-Related Startup
Summary: Wall Street is putting more money behind a technology it once dismissed as a fad.

Title: Former Agent Admits Stealing $820,000 in Bitcoin, Pleads Guilty in Silk Road Probe
Summary: Former Secret Service agent Shaun Bridges has pleaded guilty to charges related to the theft of electronic currency during a probe into the online drug bazaar Silk Road.

Title: Japanese Police Arrest Mark Karpelès of Collapsed Bitcoin Exchange Mt. Gox
Summary: Japanese police arrested Mark Karpelès, the head of collapsed bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox, alleging that he manipulated the company’s computer system to increase the balance in an account.

Title: How Future Bitcoin Can Prevent a Future Greece
Summary: Bitcoin, the volatile digital currency, cannot help the Greeks of today. But it could mean a great deal to those caught up in currency crises to come.

Title: A Bitcoin Fund Is Born, With Teething Pains
Summary: An ETF-type bitcoin investment, full of risks, is struggling for acceptance.

Title: It Was Meant to Be the Better Bitcoin. It’s Down Nearly 90%
Summary: The underperformance of Bitcoin Cash touches on a larger question: Can virtual currencies really become a means of payment that would supplant traditional money?

Title: China Is Getting Even Tougher on Cryptocurrencies a Year After Its Crackdown
Summary: China is tightening its clampdown on cryptocurrencies, nearly a year after the government imposed a wide-ranging ban on local exchanges and fundraising for digital currencies.

Title: Nvidia Clears Its Crypto Cloud
Summary: A volatile crypto market has been a distraction for the chip maker—and its investors.

Title: Cryptocurrency Market Plumbs New Depths in 2018
Summary: A broad investor retreat has pushed the market for digital currencies down 70% from its January high, reflecting user frustration over their modest inroads into commerce and a general shakeout in speculative investments.

Title: The Mystery Behind Tether, the Crypto World’s Digital Dollar
Summary: A fast-growing digital currency that claims to be backed by U.S. dollars has become a cornerstone of the volatile cryptocurrency market. The problem: There isn’t hard evidence the cash supporting it exists.

Title: The Man Who Solved Bitcoin’s Most Notorious Heist
Summary: Rampant thefts are taking the shine off cryptocurrencies. After the massive Mt. Gox exchange hack, Kim Nilsson decided to fight back.

Title: Iranian Hackers Turn to Ransomware, Bitcoin as Economy Stalls
Summary: Over the past two years, researchers have tracked five new types of so-called ransomware they say were built by hackers in Iran.

Title: NYSE’s Owner to Launch Bitcoin Firm, Futures Contracts
Summary: The New York Stock Exchange’s owner, ICE, is launching a new bitcoin company and futures contracts based on the digital currency.

Title: SEC Rejects Winklevoss Bitcoin ETF Proposal
Summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission has denied an application for an exchange-traded fund that would track the price of bitcoin, the latest indication that regulators are still uneasy with the cryptocurrency market.

Title: Is Bitcoin Back? Cryptocurrency Crosses $8,000 for First Time in Two Months
Summary: The price of bitcoin jumped above $8,000, extending a rally that has lifted the largest cryptocurrency by market value to its highest level in two months.

Title: Will Bitcoin Save Us From Google?
Summary: Maybe the seeds of destruction already have been planted at the search giant.

Title: How Bitcoin Fueled Russian Hacks
Summary: The Russian intelligence officers charged with hacking into the Democratic National Committee and Hillary Clinton’s 2016 presidential campaign used bitcoin to finance and obscure their operations, according to an indictment obtained by special counsel Robert Mueller’s office.

Title: New York Stock Exchange Executive to Join Winklevoss Bitcoin Firm
Summary: A bitcoin exchange has hired the New York Stock Exchange’s top technology executive—Robert Cornish—the latest sign that cryptocurrency trading platforms are seeking to look more like traditional markets.

Title: A Fifth of All Bitcoin Is Missing. These Crypto Hunters Can Help
Summary: A new crop of digital sleuths is working with investors and law enforcement to find misplaced or inaccessible cryptocurrency.

Title: What Crypto Downturn? ICO Fundraising Surges in 2018
Summary: A regulatory crackdown has failed to derail initial coin offerings, a controversial fundraising method.

Title: This Company Helps Bitcoin Millionaires Unleash Their Fortunes
Summary: You generally can’t pay bills or buy stocks with cryptocurrency, unless you exchange it and risk missing out on future upswings. A new lending platform called Salt offers a high-interest solution.

Title: Court Blocks Payday for Chief of Bankrupt Mt. Gox Bitcoin Exchange
Summary: Creditors in Mt. Gox, a bitcoin exchange that collapsed in February 2014, are in line for a bigger payday after blocking a liquidation that could have netted former exchange chief Mark Karpelès hundreds of millions of dollars.

Title: Is Bitcoin the Future, or an Echo of a Failed Past?
Summary: Digital currencies remind some of the spread of private money in the early 19th century.

Title: Bitcoin Pushes Ancient Gold Market to Try Digital
Summary: Some makers and sellers of gold coins and bars are turning to blockchain, the digital ledger that underpins bitcoin, hoping to add some cryptocurrency luster to bullion trading.

Title: Ether Shouldn’t Be Subject to SEC Regulation, Official Says
Summary: Ether, a cryptocurrency on par with bitcoin, isn’t subject to the extensive investor-protection rules the U.S. securities regulator enforces.

Title: Inside the Chaotic Launch of a $4 Billion Crypto Project
Summary: EOS raised $4 billion on the promise of a blockchain platform that could change the way the internet works. But infighting among its fragmented developers shows it still has a ways to go.

Title: U.S. Regulator Demands Trading Data From Bitcoin Exchanges in Manipulation Probe
Summary: Government investigators have demanded that several bitcoin exchanges hand over comprehensive trading data to assist a probe into whether manipulation is distorting prices in markets linked to the cryptocurrency.

Title: Coinbase Expands With Deal for Broker-Dealer Keystone Capital
Summary: Coinbase, one of the leading cryptocurrency and bitcoin businesses, is acquiring a securities dealer that the company hopes will allow it to move into the red-hot coin-offerings market.

Title: New Bitcoin ETF Would Set Buyers Back $200,000
Summary: New York-based asset manager Van Eck Associates and SolidX Management, a New York-based startup, filed an application with the Securities and Exchange Commission for permission to launch a regulated bitcoin ETF.

Title: Coinbase Wants to Pounce on Another Cryptocurrency Paradise: Japan
Summary: The operator of the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange is setting up shop in Japan, where much of the world’s bitcoin trading takes place.

Title: Can the Biggest U.S. Bitcoin Exchange Win Over Wall Street?
Summary: Coinbase enjoyed phenomenal growth in late 2017 as small investors piled into bitcoin. Now it is trying to attract hedge funds and other big investors.

Title: The Eureka Moment That Made Bitcoin Possible
Summary: A key insight for the technology came to a physicist almost three decades ago at a Friendly’s restaurant in New Jersey.

Title: Market Players Envision Stock Exchange Powered by Blockchain
Summary: As regulators crack down on the fraud-tainted business of initial coin offerings, some market operators are exploring ways to bring them in line with U.S. securities law.

Title: Blockchain Talent Wars Escalate, Hindering Product Development
Summary: Million-dollar signing bonuses and lucrative incentives are being thrown at crypto-savvy software developers as blockchain-based startups scramble to deliver on their promise.

Title: Small Banks’ New Money Maker: Bitcoin
Summary: To many banks, bitcoin and other digital currencies are a mania, or worse. But to a handful of small lenders, they are a moneymaker.

Title: Crypto Enthusiasts Mob New York Conference
Summary: The price of a bitcoin is down more than 50% this year, but enthusiasm for cryptocurrencies and related projects has hardly been dented, judging by the throngs at an annual crypto conference.

Title: Big Bitcoin Exchange Welcomes High-Speed Traders
Summary: Coinbase, which operates the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange, said it would upgrade its systems with services that cater to ultrafast traders, which would make it one of the first bitcoin exchanges to welcome high-speed trading.

Title: Bitcoin May Be Down, but a Digital Currency Startup Still Soars
Summary: Circle Internet Financial, backed by Goldman Sachs, is worth about $3 billion after a new fundraising round.

Title: Steve Eisman of ‘The Big Short’ Bashes Cryptocurrency: ‘I Don’t See the Purpose of It’
Summary: Steve Eisman, who earned celebrity status for betting against subprime mortgages a decade ago, isn’t a fan of cryptocurrencies. He says they have increased in popularity for only two reasons: speculation and money laundering.

Title: Bitcoin Prices Slide as South Korea’s Largest Crypto Exchange Gets Raided
Summary: Bitcoin tumbled as South Korea’s largest digital-currency exchange came under investigation by local authorities, the latest in an expanding crackdown on cryptocurrencies.

Title: Jetpacks and Tech-Enabled Cities: How We’ll Live in the Future
Summary: Innovators are spinning transportation forward, cities are using data to get smarter and payments are getting digital. Experts at WSJ’s Future of Everything Festival talk about the consequences, good and bad.

Title: Blockchain ETF Asks for Patience
Summary: Spotlight: An ETF based on companies involved with blockchain technology is off to a bumpy start, but its founder is staying focused on the long term.

Title: Square’s Loss Widens as Spending Picks Up
Summary: Square reported a wider first-quarter loss as the financial-technology firm spent more on product development and marketing, and signaled that it would continue to invest big sums.

Title: Peter Thiel-Backed Venture to Help Big Investors Bet on Bitcoin
Summary: Founders Fund is among investors in an early-stage startup that expects to be the bitcoin version of a broker-dealer.

Title: To Catch Bad Actors, Winklevosses’ Bitcoin Exchange Teams Up With Nasdaq
Summary: Gemini, the bitcoin exchange founded by Cameron and, has teamed up with Nasdaq to beef up its defenses against market manipulation.

Title: Inside the Chaotic Launch of a $4 Billion Crypto Project
Summary: EOS raised $4 billion on the promise of a blockchain platform that could change the way the internet works. But infighting among its fragmented developers shows it still has a ways to go.

Title: U.S. Regulator Demands Trading Data From Bitcoin Exchanges in Manipulation Probe
Summary: Government investigators have demanded that several bitcoin exchanges hand over comprehensive trading data to assist a probe into whether manipulation is distorting prices in markets linked to the cryptocurrency.

Title: Coinbase Expands With Deal for Broker-Dealer Keystone Capital
Summary: Coinbase, one of the leading cryptocurrency and bitcoin businesses, is acquiring a securities dealer that the company hopes will allow it to move into the red-hot coin-offerings market.

Title: New Bitcoin ETF Would Set Buyers Back $200,000
Summary: New York-based asset manager Van Eck Associates and SolidX Management, a New York-based startup, filed an application with the Securities and Exchange Commission for permission to launch a regulated bitcoin ETF.

Title: Coinbase Wants to Pounce on Another Cryptocurrency Paradise: Japan
Summary: The operator of the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange is setting up shop in Japan, where much of the world’s bitcoin trading takes place.

Title: Can the Biggest U.S. Bitcoin Exchange Win Over Wall Street?
Summary: Coinbase enjoyed phenomenal growth in late 2017 as small investors piled into bitcoin. Now it is trying to attract hedge funds and other big investors.

Title: The Eureka Moment That Made Bitcoin Possible
Summary: A key insight for the technology came to a physicist almost three decades ago at a Friendly’s restaurant in New Jersey.

Title: Market Players Envision Stock Exchange Powered by Blockchain
Summary: As regulators crack down on the fraud-tainted business of initial coin offerings, some market operators are exploring ways to bring them in line with U.S. securities law.

Title: Blockchain Talent Wars Escalate, Hindering Product Development
Summary: Million-dollar signing bonuses and lucrative incentives are being thrown at crypto-savvy software developers as blockchain-based startups scramble to deliver on their promise.

Title: Small Banks’ New Money Maker: Bitcoin
Summary: To many banks, bitcoin and other digital currencies are a mania, or worse. But to a handful of small lenders, they are a moneymaker.

Title: Crypto Enthusiasts Mob New York Conference
Summary: The price of a bitcoin is down more than 50% this year, but enthusiasm for cryptocurrencies and related projects has hardly been dented, judging by the throngs at an annual crypto conference.

Title: Big Bitcoin Exchange Welcomes High-Speed Traders
Summary: Coinbase, which operates the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange, said it would upgrade its systems with services that cater to ultrafast traders, which would make it one of the first bitcoin exchanges to welcome high-speed trading.

Title: Bitcoin May Be Down, but a Digital Currency Startup Still Soars
Summary: Circle Internet Financial, backed by Goldman Sachs, is worth about $3 billion after a new fundraising round.

Title: Steve Eisman of ‘The Big Short’ Bashes Cryptocurrency: ‘I Don’t See the Purpose of It’
Summary: Steve Eisman, who earned celebrity status for betting against subprime mortgages a decade ago, isn’t a fan of cryptocurrencies. He says they have increased in popularity for only two reasons: speculation and money laundering.

Title: Bitcoin Prices Slide as South Korea’s Largest Crypto Exchange Gets Raided
Summary: Bitcoin tumbled as South Korea’s largest digital-currency exchange came under investigation by local authorities, the latest in an expanding crackdown on cryptocurrencies.

Title: Jetpacks and Tech-Enabled Cities: How We’ll Live in the Future
Summary: Innovators are spinning transportation forward, cities are using data to get smarter and payments are getting digital. Experts at WSJ’s Future of Everything Festival talk about the consequences, good and bad.

Title: Blockchain ETF Asks for Patience
Summary: Spotlight: An ETF based on companies involved with blockchain technology is off to a bumpy start, but its founder is staying focused on the long term.

Title: Square’s Loss Widens as Spending Picks Up
Summary: Square reported a wider first-quarter loss as the financial-technology firm spent more on product development and marketing, and signaled that it would continue to invest big sums.

Title: Peter Thiel-Backed Venture to Help Big Investors Bet on Bitcoin
Summary: Founders Fund is among investors in an early-stage startup that expects to be the bitcoin version of a broker-dealer.

Title: To Catch Bad Actors, Winklevosses’ Bitcoin Exchange Teams Up With Nasdaq
Summary: Gemini, the bitcoin exchange founded by Cameron and, has teamed up with Nasdaq to beef up its defenses against market manipulation.

Title: Russian Farmer Alters Rural Economy With Virtual Currency, as Moscow Watches Warily
Summary: Cryptocurrency begun by a Russian ‘agro-anarchist’ has become a tender of choice for transactions from milk to tractors in a poor region that Russia’s energy boom left behind.

Title: Merger Isn’t the Only Option for Renault and Nissan, Ghosn Says
Summary: The chief executive of the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi alliance said at The Wall Street Journal’s D.Live tech conference that he is open to a merger of Renault and Nissan, but there may be other alternatives.

Title: New York Pushes Crypto Exchanges for More Transparency
Summary: The New York Attorney General‘s office sent a letter requesting information from 13 exchanges specializing in cryptocurrencies, saying investors dealing in the markets often don’t have the basic facts needed to protect themselves.

Title: Prominent Crypto Hedge Fund Says Worst Is Over for Bitcoin
Summary: San Francisco-based Pantera Capital Management called $6,500 the probable low for bitcoin in the current bear market. The investment firm also said it was “highly likely” that bitcoin will hit new highs and exceed $20,000 within a year. Pantera, a leading voice in the crypto market, makes rare—but significant—short-term calls.

Title: Bitcoin’s Hype Vanishes Just Like That: ‘We’re in the Boring Phase’
Summary: After bitcoin’s frenzied mania last year, the virtual currency's price has lost about two-thirds of its value from a December high and trading volume is about 70% lower than on the most active days.

Title: Townhouse Listed for $30 Million—or $45 Million in Bitcoin
Summary: A hedge-fund founder and tech investor is listing his Manhattan townhouse for almost $30 million—or $45 million in digital currency.

Title: Cryptocurrency Firm Coinbase in Talks to Become SEC-Regulated Brokerage
Summary: Coinbase, a leading cryptocurrency firm, has approached U.S. regulators about registering as a licensed brokerage firm and electronic-trading venue, according to people familiar with the matter.

Title: Monex Snaps Up Coincheck as Firms Compete in Cryptocurrency Land Grab
Summary: Internet brokerage Monex Group said Friday it would buy beleaguered bitcoin exchange Coincheck for about $34 million, becoming the latest established Japanese internet firm to jump into cryptocurrencies.

Title: Regulators World-Wide Are Cracking Down on Cryptocurrencies. India’s Next.
Summary: The clampdown on cryptocurrencies is gaining momentum. The latest to take action is India, which vowed to prevent financial institutions from engaging in the currencies.

Title: South Korea Detains Cryptocurrency Executives on Embezzlement Allegations
Summary: South Korean prosecutors detained the heads of two cryptocurrency exchanges for allegedly embezzling customers’ assets, the latest in a string of enforcement actions tied to suspected malfeasance in the country’s bitcoin market.

Title: Bitcoin Brouhaha: Cryptocurrency Exchange OKEx Denies Price Tampering
Summary: A large cryptocurrency exchange denied accusations from some customers it manipulated prices of bitcoin futures after sudden price swings on its trading platform last week.

Title: Coincheck, Roiled by Hack, Might Have Found Its White Knight
Summary: Japanese internet brokerage Monex Group said it is looking at acquiring Coincheck, the cryptocurrency exchange that suffered one of the industry’s worst hacks in January.

Title: Bitcoin’s First-Quarter Play: Falling Back to Earth
Summary: The first quarter was a prime example of why investors shouldn’t get too excited about bitcoin, which posted its second-worst quarter ever.

Title: What the Fed Could Learn From Bitcoin
Summary: The cryptocurrency is committed to passive monetary policy.

Title: PwC Has an Answer for the Blockchain: Audit It
Summary: PricewaterhouseCoopers unveiled a new offering to audit companies’ use of the blockchain—making sure companies are implementing and using it properly, and allowing people within a company to continuously monitor its blockchain transactions.

Title: Do You Own Bitcoin? The IRS Is Coming for You
Summary: The IRS is moving to crack down on cryptocurrency scofflaws, collecting data on about 13,000 Coinbase account holders who bought, sold, sent or received digital currency worth $20,000 or more between 2013 and 2015.

Title: South Korea Confiscated Computers, Records in Cryptocurrency Raids
Summary: Prosecutors last month raided three cryptocurrency exchanges in South Korea’s capital, after a government investigation revealed that a portion of customers’ assets had been transferred to private bank accounts belonging to top managers at the exchanges.

Title: When Will Stocks Tumble Again? Investors Look to Bitcoin for Answers
Summary: Investors are latching onto bitcoin as a new indicator for determining whether the stock market is headed for another downturn.

Title: Why Blockchain Will Survive, Even If Bitcoin Doesn’t
Summary: Forget bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies: Here’s how blockchain, the underlying technology, is actually going to change critical if unsexy functions in shipping, real estate and…diamonds.

Title: Japan Suspends Trading on Two Cryptocurrency Exchanges
Summary: Japan’s financial regulator punished several cryptocurrency exchanges on Thursday, part of new restrictions following an apparent $530 million heist at one of its larger crypto platforms, Coincheck.

Title: Russian Farmer Alters Rural Economy With Virtual Currency, as Moscow Watches Warily
Summary: Cryptocurrency begun by a Russian ‘agro-anarchist’ has become a tender of choice for transactions from milk to tractors in a poor region that Russia’s energy boom left behind.
